title: SQL Server / select count users per combinaison of individual items
body:
users have licenses, and a license plan is made of several licenses. I want to count the number of users per each plan.

I have the following tables :

  • Users : UserName, UserID
  • Licenses : LicenseName, LicenseID
  • Plans : PlanName, PlanID
  • UsersAndLicenses : UserID, LicenseID
  • PlansAndLicenses : PlanID, LicenseID

For each plan I need to get the number of users who have the licenses which correspond to the plan. I can't understand which select will allow me to get the right result.

Any help is welcome !
